summary: A simple mod that combines some of the Enchanting perks together in order to conserve perk points when filling out the tree.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/KK7LOim.png[/img][/center]

Simple Enchanting is a mod that aims to combine some of the perks in the Enchanting tree together, to save perk points when filling out the tree. I've always really hated having to use 11 perk points to maximize Enchanting efficiency, and this mod takes it down to a total of 6. This was thrown together for personal use and I hadn't planned on putting it up, but if somebody else wants it then hey, they can go for it.

[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/FgV18S1.png[/img][/center]

[b][SIZE=7]New perks added by this mod:[/SIZE][/b]

[b]- Novice Enchanter: New enchantments are 20% stronger. (Enchanter rank 1)

- Apprentice Enchanter: New enchantments are 40% stronger. Requires an Enchanting skill of 20. (Enchanter rank 2)

- Journeyman Enchanter: New enchantments are 60% stronger. Elemental enchantments are 25% more powerful. Requires an Enchanting skill of 40. (Enchanter rank 3 + Fire Enchanter, Frost Enchanter, and Storm Enchanter)

- Expert Enchanter: New enchantments are 80% stronger. Skill enchantments are 25% more powerful. Requires an Enchanting skill of 60. (Enchanter rank 4 + Insightful Enchanter)

- Master Enchanter: New enchantments are 100% stronger. Requires an Enchanting skill of 80. Health, magicka, and stamina enchantments are 25% more powerful. (Enchanter rank 5 + Corpus Enchanter)[/b]

Each of the new perks combines some of the vanilla perk effects in order to conserve perk points when going up the Enchanting tree. The new perks do this by unlocking the vanilla perks behind the scenes, to ensure full compatibility with everything that they should be compatible with. Other perks (Extra Effect, Soul Siphon, and Soul Squeezer) are untouched.

In addition, this mod is fully compatible with existing characters. It will detect which perks you should have based on the vanilla ones you've already taken, and grant the corresponding perks from this mod.

[b][SIZE=7]Installation[/SIZE][/b]

I recommend installing with Nexus Mod Manager. Otherwise, add the SimpleEnchantingTree.esp file to your Skyrim/data folder.

[b][SIZE=7]Compatibility[/SIZE][/b]

This mod should be compatible with any mod that doesn't touch the Enchanting tree. Probably not so compatible with overhaul mods, such as PerMa.
